column8: Un Chien Andalou (An Andalusian Dog) is a French silent surrealist film produced by Spaniards Luis Bunuel and Salvador Dali. It only went for 16 minutes, but it was very popular and remains one of the best known surrealist films to come out of the avant-garde movement of the 1920's.
column21:
A t shirt celebrating Un Chien Andalou (An Andalusian Dog), a French silent surrealist film produced by Spaniards Luis Bunuel and Salvador Dali. It only went for 16 minutes, but it was very popular and remains one of the best known surrealist films to come out of the avant-garde movement of the 1920's.

From weadmire.net.
